clinical_question: Should patients with RA on their first TNF Inhibitor who are NOT at target, switch to a 2nd TNF Inhibitor or switch to a boDMARD targeting a different molecule or to a tsDMARD?
population: Patients with RA on DMARDs who are in low disease activity
intervention: Taper off DMARDs (as long as the patient remains on at least one DMARD)
comparator: Abruptly withdraw DMARDs (as long as the patient remains on at least one DMARD)
outcome: Disease activity (follow up: range 9 months to 12 months; assessed with: DAS28-ESR)

Imprecision.rationales: CI includes both values suggesting benefit and values suggesting no effect

Effect.Abbreviations: CI: Confidence interval; RR: Risk ratio; MD: Mean difference; HR: Hazard Ratio

clinical_question: Should patients with RA on their first TNF Inhibitor who are NOT at target, switch to a 2nd TNF Inhibitor or switch to a boDMARD targeting a different molecule or to a tsDMARD?
population: Patients with RA on DMARDs who are in low disease activity
intervention: Taper off DMARDs (as long as the patient remains on at least one DMARD)
comparator: Abruptly withdraw DMARDs (as long as the patient remains on at least one DMARD)
outcome: Flare (follow up: range 6 months to 12 months)

Inconsistency.rationales: Downgraded by one level due to serious inconsistency. Unexplained heterogeneity I2=78%

Effect.Abbreviations: CI: Confidence interval; RR: Risk ratio; MD: Mean difference; HR: Hazard Ratio

clinical_question: Should patients with RA on their first TNF Inhibitor who are NOT at target, switch to a 2nd TNF Inhibitor or switch to a boDMARD targeting a different molecule or to a tsDMARD?
population: Patients with RA on DMARDs who are in low disease activity
intervention: Taper off DMARDs (as long as the patient remains on at least one DMARD)
comparator: Abruptly withdraw DMARDs (as long as the patient remains on at least one DMARD)
outcome: Radiographic progression (follow up: range 9 months to 12 months; assessed with: mTSS)

Risk of bias.rationales: Study contributing most of the weight is at risk of bias associated with missing data and selective outcome reporting

Effect.Abbreviations: CI: Confidence interval; RR: Risk ratio; MD: Mean difference; HR: Hazard Ratio
